intro: Macrocarpaea affinis, commonly known as the New Zealand rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense heads. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine, fuzzy layer. Macrocarpaea affinis thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and subalpine regions.
